column8: A family-friendly park brimming with activities for everyone to enjoy.
column11: Viharamahadevi Park, previously called Victoria Park, stands as Colombo’s oldest and largest public park, providing a tranquil retreat right in the city centre. Situated directly opposite the delightful colonial-era Town Hall and adjacent to the intriguing National Museum, this location serves as a lively green sanctuary for all to appreciate.  If you're in search of a serene getaway, a fun-filled family day, or a picturesque location for your photography, Viharamahadevi Park presents a delightful mix of natural charm and cultural significance right in the centre of Colombo. The park presents an array of activities, featuring horse riding, an enjoyable mini train ride, and a well-appointed play area for the little ones. The walking paths invite you to enjoy a leisurely stroll, and the exercise area provides an excellent opportunity for adults to maintain their fitness. The park boasts lush greenery and a serene atmosphere, creating the perfect setting for relaxation while the children have their fun. This destination is impeccably maintained and provides a variety of activities, ensuring it's an essential stop for families seeking outdoor enjoyment and a chance to unwind. This park features a stunning massive golden Buddha statue that truly stands out.

Viharamahadevi Park – A Green Oasis in Colombo Viharamahadevi Park, the largest and oldest park in Colombo, is a beautiful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Located near the iconic Town Hall, this lush green space is perfect for nature lovers, families, and anyone looking for a relaxing outdoor experience. Highlights: ✅ Scenic Beauty – The park boasts well-maintained gardens, towering trees, and colorful flower beds that create a peaceful atmosphere. ✅ Relaxing Environment – It’s a great spot for a morning jog, an evening stroll, or simply unwinding under the shade. ✅ Play Area for Kids – Families with children will love the dedicated play area with swings, slides, and other fun activities. ✅ Historical & Cultural Significance – The park is named after Queen Viharamahadevi, the mother of King Dutugemunu, adding historical value to its charm. ✅ Golden Buddha Statue – A stunning golden statue of Buddha sits prominently within the park, attracting visitors and spiritual seekers alike. Things to Keep in Mind: ❌ Can be crowded during weekends and public holidays. ❌ Some areas may need better maintenance. ❌ Be mindful of street vendors and occasional beggars near the entrance

Our guide was incredibly proud to show us this park and on first impressions, it did indeed look very pleasant - well manicured, peaceful and clean.  However, our trip came to an abrupt end when we casually went led to the elephants, being kept in a little wooded  glade in the park.  Granted they were in the shade, and admittedly they appeared to have a mountain of food provided for them BUT they were both SHACKLED by one leg!!! I appreciate that this may be a cultural thing, but my animal loving conscience will rest better knowing that I told my guide I was leaving immediately!  Regardless of their intended purpose, or the fact that according to the guide they are released at 6pm each evening (yeah right!), elephants are not in their natural habitat - and therefore can’t be truly happy - when they are expected to stand still all day in the centre of the city!!!! I wouldn’t recommend or go back to this place, regardless of how pretty the park is.

I have been visiting the colourful Vihara Mahadevi park for over 50 years, then as a youngster and now as a retiree going there for a morning walk and relaxation.  I have seen its evolution and the renovations since 1962.  It continues to be an oasis in the centre of Colombo city and measures approximately 1000 ha.  The walking path along the perimeter is approximately 2 km in length. The park had been originally named after Queen Victoria with her statue adorning the northern entrance facing the colonial style Colombo Town (City) Hall.  A large beautiful picturesque Buddha statue has since replaced the Victoria statue.  The original Victoria statue now lies at the entrance to Laksala opposite the Southern park entrance.  The park was later renamed after the famous historical Lankan queen – Vihara Mahadevi whose statue lies adjacent to one of the prominent walking paths.  Buddha statue is a popular photographic location. This oasis in the city is well maintained with its well-manicured green gardens, trees large and small, flowers and flower beds, fountains and many walking paths.  In the centre is a little pond where ducks with colourful bills swim around with their natural grace.  On the western side of the park is the children’s section with a play-train and a large colourful playhouse with swings, staircases and slides.  Kids and adults too can enjoy a snack from the many kiosks that line the path near the playhouse.  One can hire a bicycle that you can ride along the specified cycling path.  There are many comfortable benches too - often occupied by young dreamy romantic couples. Many people come to the park in the mornings and evenings for a walk.  Near the pond are some exercise machines for aerobic exercising.  Many families visit here to relax, picnic and spend the day with the family.  Bridal groups too come here often early in the mornings for a photographic session. At the south western corner are a war memorial for those who lost their lives during the second world war and the Colombo Public Library. There are adequate public toilets within the park.  Parking is available on the roads bounding the park. I was prompted to write this article today (08/02/2020) as I found as many as 26 domesticated elephants at the southern section of the park.  They had been brought to Colombo to take part in the colourful annual festival at the nearby Gangarama Buddhist temple.  They were being fed with coconut leaves and mahouts were bathing them at a concrete lined pond.  Many people had come to witness this spectacle of elephants in the city!

I was in Colombo for 3 days. I stayed at a hostel along Vauxhall Street at Slave Island and on a late afternoon I decided to walk my way to Gangaramaya Temple. From the temple, I walked across a busy road and coincidentally bumped into this green park. The park was located opposite the Municipal Town Hall. On my way, I visited the Town Hall and was lucky to be given a free map of Colombo city. I roamed around the park and found the environment calm and serene. There was a children playground, a restaurant, a magnificent Buddhist statue and few sculptures near the front entrance. It was also called Victoria Park in her early days. Compared to the Botanical Garden in Singapore, this park is not very big but it is the largest park in Colombo city. Heavy traffic jammed the roads and emitted irritating pollutants and the weather was intensely hot when I visit Colombo. I was glad to see this green oasis right in the middle of this bustling city. While there is nothing much to appreciate in the park other than the statues and children playgrounds, the park provides a short respite for travelers in a calm and serene setting. One side of the park faces the public library and the National Museum while at another corner was the street gallery exhibiting artwork. I was impressed with the colorful and bold art pieces on display. Further down from the park is the Independence Square. But I missed it because my legs were too tired to walk. It is an ordinarily park and is free. The Buddha statue is unique but the children play ground and the park itself are just ordinary.

The Viharamahadevi Park is a public urban type one located in Colombo-7, next to the Colonial era massive Colombo Town Hall of the Colombo Municipal Council. It occupies a large area where boundaries are the 4 roads Sri jayawardenapura Rd (South), C.W.W. Kannnangara Mw (East), F.R Sennanayake Rd ( NorthEast), and Srimath anagarika Dharmapala Mw (North West). It was previously dedicated to the Queen Victoria and named as the Victoria Park. It is opened all year round from 8 am to 6 pm.  It is the oldest and largest park of the city of Colombo. The park is named after Queen Viharamahadevi, the mother of King Dutugamunu. King Dutigamunu was the elder son out of the two who loved the public  and fought to free Sri Lanka from the invader Elara. Princess Viharamahadevi was set off on the sea in a boat by her King father when a the sea flowed inside the land in the history as a means of requesting the relief from the problem from Gods. Previously there were fences all round the park and with the new recent renovation, they adopted a new concept such as open to any one from any side. The passers by could see things happening inside the park. With the new concept the park joins with its surroundings, the four roads being the first on each side. The tourist attractions;  Gangayamaya temple, Beire lake, Seema Maalaka Floating Temple  and the Galle Face Green are not too far away from the park. The important tourists attractions are also nearby across the adjoining road to the South are; Nelumpokuna   / Art Gallery side/ National Museum;and  on the North  side is the Town Hall. On its Western end locates the Cenotaph War Memorial, Colombo and the Colombo Public Library. During the British rule era of Sri Lanka the park was built on a land donated to the Colombo city by Charles Henry de Soysa, and named it then as "Victoria Park" after the Queen Victoria, During World War II, it was occupied by the British Army with Australian 17th Brigade based at Victoria Park. After the war the park was restored and open to the public in 1951. The park has a huge Buddha statue and a series of water fountains. It also includes a mini zoo, a children's play area and a BAC Jet Provost. The park is maintained by the Colombo Municipal Council. The Vihara Maha Devi Park has an Open Air Stadium which is a venue for concerts and public events. However, it is cooler during the day due to the shades of the trees. Most uses of the park are the couples, families, some groups, and some school children who visit Colombo on their annual trips which is a must do activity in the first term itself. The park cleaners /, the police with a police vehicle (3 in number when I went in) are seen in the park. Police allow the couples on their own maintaining privacy and sometimes police send them  off them if they do not behave well. At the South beside the Sri Jayawardenepura Rd,a large parking area is located and even big buses could be stop there. Across the road on the South, there are display of arts of paintings for selling beside the road. When walked into the park through the Town Hall end, you can see the long square pools of water in the center, the aquarium on the far left end, the lake, suspension bridge, candy floss and pony rides on the far right, and the World War memorial at the western end. Viharamahadevi park has come a long with improvements since the 1990's. There are a lot of the old high trees that give a welcomed shade. This gives a little wild look but the park is meticulously maintained, with the beautiful paved pathways, some flanked by palm trees and lush, even grass on the ground. There are some surprising little seating structures in the park, sleek and pleasant, mostly made of wood and concrete.The most popular attraction at the park is the lake and the woody suspension bridge above it. The kids and sometimes adults get the enjoyment from walking on it and peering down at the lake below. Children really like to spend time in the park as there is plenty of play-spaces. Children's activities are found in the children's corner. Therefore the park is best suited for the families and the couples. Recently the little hills is  landscaped inside the park. Blue and purple paved pathways roll on top of the hills, and some parts of the hills are carved with tunnels through which kids  get enjoyment by crawling.  Around these mini-hills are      mat-slides, swings and the whole works. Nearby it, there  is a big plastic play-house for younger kids, and the huge blue circle on the ground that turns into a watery play-zone for children with sprinklers operative  at 5 pm. Ponies are caged in an open square fenced with wood around this area. They carry kids on their backs or dragging small carriages of children, for a charge. Candy floss are sold at at Viharamahadevi Park, right next to the kids' play-house. Ice cream truck guy is also found there selling them. Aquarium is located to the East side of the park.  There are a many types of little fishes, some of them are beautiful, a tiny little lobster and two baby turtles. Entry to the aquarium is charged.One bathroom is near the aquarium and others in different locations. Very nice park with authentic plants and trees. The gardener could make for you an excursion, There is a big spot for huge bats, that are hanging on the trees. It's an amazing park in the heart of Colombo. It takes away the rush of the city and can relax peacefully. People do their morning exercise here and do jogging along the jogging tracks, as government promote people to do exercises/ jogging in order to maintain health and to keep fit.

The park has a lake with a bridge, walkways, fish species, Kids' activities, canteen, etc... But, without anything just sitting down under a tree and watching my daughter playing is what I like.... entrance from the town hall side is bit non- crowd place and can find a space for us... Go.. spend some hours here... you will feel it... A treasure in Busy Colombo...

Busy park with some interesting trees, lake large grassy areas. Buy an ice cream and watch the world go buy. Full of school groups eating lunch when we visited, all very organised. There is one way traffic over lake bridge, but this is only shown from  one side which could explain why we waited for ages for atleast one school to pass by, but all very happy and polite. Not a destination as such but definitely worth stopping by here,  if only for a beak if you are sight Sightseeing in area,  although ram packed on Sundays so avoid those if you can.
The park has good walkways, a Buddha statue and a smallish restaurant to eat some food or grab a coffee. Could spend some time just walking around here in the late afternoon or evening.

In our city tour, my son and his wife decided to shop from “Cotton Shop”, a small mall, while I, My wife and my granddaughter decided to visit this park in front of the mall. This park is a medium size garden for public. There are some games for kids. There is no fees either for entry or for games. A neat and clean park. Can spend some spare time.

This place is very busy with people when it comes to holidays. Can access to every one &  its a help to every level of people. Can do several  activities as well. Children are allowed to  have a free bath at noon time with nice showers on.
Just a big park with free entrance, nothing really to see here except some bat colonies among the branches.

This is a great park to spend the day with kids. There are lots of activities including paddle boats. They also sometimes have events at the open air theatre. IT gets quiet on weeknights but busy on weekend nights

worth a walk with a good range and variety of diverse things such as mini rail, paddle water boats, fountains as well as green lawns trees as well as an amphitheatre - all age ranges from couples under trees to young families with children and sprinkling of tourists
Very good atmosphere trees Greenery Sperate playing area for kids Good for relaxing walk Couples visible daytime not after 6pm Eliminate at night with solar lights Cheers
This park is the home place for many beautiful trees and singing birds. It's nice to walk under the shadow of the trees listening to birds. Maintained very clean.

This park is a public park located in Colombo 7and a great spot for picnics and for families with children. It is the oldest and largest park in Colombo. It is located in front of the colonial-era Town Hall building and was originally named after Queen Viharamahadevi although during the British rule it was called "Victoria Park" after Queen Victoria.

Very well maintain but nothing special and nothing to do around. Free entry. Great worth kids as there is a nice playground, toilets and pick-nick facilities. There is also a little food (snack) restaurant.
This is the place to see children out enjoying sports clubs. There are lots of fountains so couples go there for their engagement and wedding pictures to be taken.

This park is ideal for a midday relaxation too cool down from the Colombo weather. There is a gold statue of buddah in the middle of the park and there are many seats around the park as well. This is a popular location that couples come to relax. There are also many art stalls and some food stalls on the street near the park.

It is nice walk here in the part especially in the evenings. Can enjoy the local fruit juices. Approx 1-2 hours would be ideal for us to walk there and not longer. In the evening, need some mosquito repellents cream. Leisure is what is expected in this park. Noticed a horse riding for kids too. Very crowded on weekends.

Thanks to TripAdvisor we had planned to visit Cirque Lanka  as part of our stay in Columbo. The park is impressive and provided a leisurely walk taking in a local fruit juice and homemade cakes at a friendly clean cafe. The theatre was easy to find and we returned that evening for the show. Be sure to find and marvel at the fruit bats, flying foxes, filling the tree tops along one of the paths. A most impressive sight especially if like us this is your first sighting! The evening walk was along a well lit path and very safe. The show was amazing, a brilliant fusion of acrobatic circus and traditional Sri Lankan dance and costume. We only realised how clever later in our travels having attended the cultural show at Kandy. Although in comparison, Cirque Lanka seems expensive, it really is well worth the money, we were absorbed in the lively performance throughout. The standard is high. We chose to sit on chairs but to save money you can opt for the stone seating in the open air auditorium. Finally the cast are friendly, radiate pride in their show and pleased to chat. Coffee and commemorative tee shirts are available to buy, as with any brilliantly organised show! Suitable for all ages, we are a young retired couple.

Really nice park with local life. Couples under every tree cuddling and showing each other love. It was really cute. Apparently there are fruitbats all around witch I didn't see as I only found out later and they are kind of hidden in the trees but a friend showed me pictures and I was a little jelouse:).

We innocently sat on a seat to rest near the library as we had to use the only toilets around and it was sunny so we decided to take a photo sitting on a bench ... the police came ruunning and shouting as there was a Buddah behind us and he could not be photographed so beware not to sit down . Nice  cafe in the centre selling fresh fruit smoothies there was a huge art exhibition on the pathways when we went.
Little gem in the middle of the city. A little piece of Sri Lankan culture. Free entry. A nice afternoon walk
I went this place with my family members. Good funny things to do there. any children will like to spend there time in wiharamahadevi park.

The park has been well laid out and has many large shady trees which have been growing for well over 100 years. There is a nice children's' playground and horse rides. The best aspect for me was seeing the bats hanging in some trees and sometimes flying around.

Viharamahadevi Park is a peaceful piece of land in the busy  capital Colombo that is full of high green with nicely maintained walking and jogging tracks. An ideal place to relax in the morning or evening or to read books field picnic.

Nice place to relax for a while. We sat down at the café in the middle of the park and observed the owner of the place feeding 'his' squirrels. Meanwhile, a snake was chasing/eating some birds or their eggs in a tree nearby. So there's even some wildlife to be seen :)
Nice place to relax with your kids and family. Spend an evening in total serenity. Feel the nature right in the middle of the city.

My friend was driving me around from 7.15 am this morning. Traffic was not an issue today being a Public Holiday. We made several stops for brief visits and photo opportunities. We drove around this lovely park in the middle of the city - it was formerly known as Victoria Park. The park has a beautiful main entrance opposite Town Hall, expansive walking areas and even an Amphitheater.....

Restful and huge park in the middle of the city. Nice to have a walk here the place is all green and very nature. There is also a huge children's play park. You feel you are close to nature. Nice place to rest and fresh up.

Colombo 's most famous park. It has a children's section where there are slides, swings and a mini train as we. There's out door amphitheatre as well. It's a very big park. It's well maintained and clean. People of all ages come here to relax.
Its good to take a nice evening walk around this place. Its quite huge and very well maintained. The Buddha statue is very good !
We visited this place in the evening the statue of lord Buddha is mesmerising and a must visit place in Colombo

This is right in the city centre and is very popular with locals, with many families taking advantage of the varied options for children: large play areas, a rope bridge over a pond, a miniature train to ride and even a mini-road system to bicycle round. That said, there are still lots of quiet spots and wide-open areas so it never felt too busy: it's a good place to get away from the mad traffic. The large statue of Buddha is also worth seeing.

Viharamahadevi is a place where you can just enjoy your time in shadow of lovely old trees with fruit bats hanging over your head. Also this time we found an aquarium in one of the bunkers there which was quite cool :)
A nice garden, clean and well maintained. The stray dogs are a nuisance. Was quite busy as we were there on a weekend.

Have been here twice with our young kids. Nice to go walking, let the kids play in the playground, take swimming gear on a hot day they have a fun water fountain play area (may just be going in weekends) Food vendors around, nice mango or Pineapple in a bag with spice on top. Ice cream vendors. Can paddle in a little boat on the pond. Nice Buddha statue there. Not amazing like  gardens you may find in Europe etc but still a nice place to go with a family to have a break from the streets. I hear they have an open air circus type thing on at night that I wish we had gone to.
Viharamahadevi park is very nice place to have some fun. Cooool place .but crowd. It's good place to play for children and walking. Evening time is the most best time for have a walk.
For me, I just wanted to glimpse the park and it's Buddha statue. The park is popular with all age groups and it is evident that it is well used and enjoyed.

It is a park open for anyone for free. Nicely maintained. In front you can see the Colombo Municipal council which was built similar to the White House in USA. And this place is nice for an evening walk. So many trees in the heart of the city . And there is a pond where you can enjoy boats.

Although millions have been spent on improving this park, it has an unkempt look as it appears to be poorly maintained. The grass is dry and needs constant watering. The paths are not clearly drawn out and the plants and vegetation do not appear neat. It's a pity that a park of this size is not made to look like parks in developed countries. The only thing that I like about it is that there is plenty of space for walking about and getting some exercise.

The park has extensive grounds and is child friendly with rides and walks for children. Adults gather here to walk and run. The park has a lot of trees providing ample shade. It is also close to the shopping malls at the Arcade and the Race Course.

Really quiet place in rushy Colombo. The gem in the corner of the park is project Cirque Lanka, that is unique mixture of European circus and traditional Sri Lankan dances. Never seen anything like that before.
Very nice and calm place in the middle of a busy center. Great for relaxing during a day. Open air auditorium with CIRQUE LANKA new circus show, is the best place to visit in the evening! Don't miss
What you see in this picture is all that is there to this place. Nothing more. Another park with this little monument at one end. and lots of couples in corners and behind trees ;)

This park is well taken care of compared to many other parks in this side of the world. It gives us tourists some pleasant time out from the buzzle of the city. It also has a couple of museums, National History Museum is quite good. The arts museum is just a an old imperialistic building, nothing special and the art was not worth the visit.

This is one of the huge park in the town. It offers many interesting activity for all age. There's also rental bike in it and kids playground. Some part of the park can be used for a show or group activities. Easily to reach since it located in the heart of the town.

The park is not that huge but what I am impressed is the amount of care people put to maintain it. The trees are huge and green grasses are everywhere. There are plenty of seating areas under the trees so one can easily relax and read a book. There is an area where there are food stalls and also there is a cafeteria. It is a fun place for kids to roam around as I meet very friendly kids there. I was also surprised that within the park there is a wifi zone.

Viharamahadevi is definitelly one of the best places in Colombo. It's quiet, green and calm. It has various possibilities how you can spend your time there. From kids playground, picnic spot to Open Air Theatre where is every night until 31st March show which combines Sri Lankan music and art with European new circus. You will love your visit.
Its a park with basic facility. I will not recommend it much . You can do better things than this. Its for kids mainly. Good place to sit for a bit relax but overall not recommended

This is located in central of colombo right infront of Colombo Town hall. most of the time parking is not an issue but it will be tough during the weekend evenings. if you need to relax with your family or need a place with ample space for your kid to play this is the best. There is an open air theater where musical shows etc takes place. good place to have a walk or an evening or morning jog. you get bicycles also there where you can pay and ride. the maintenance has become comparatively bad. still good place to be.

This place had been the single largest free park within the Colombo municipality. Especially during the evening this turns in to a very crowd place where kids can freely play. The maintenance of the area sometimes were not tidy. But a pretty good place to hangout. But should either be during the morning or evening hours.
A nice spot to get away from the hustle-bustle of Colombo traffic, and a well maintained park. However it does not start to compare with parks in many capital cities, in size or amenities.

My tour guide took me here towards the end of the day. I thought it was a nice park, where lots of people did their walk/exercise. Big park for families to hang out, have a picnic basket, friends hanging out with each other and couples enjoying each other. Nice place to unwind.

Viharamahadevi Park, known as Victoria Park, is the city central park in Colombo. After the recent renovations, couple of years back, it looks great now. Average place for a day out or a picnic, but you may disturb with beggars and young couples. Usually its crowded in the evening, you better move on in the morning. There is a small children park as well. One side of the park you can find the busy street, and on the other side full with wonderful artworks by local artists for sale.
Nice and Big Park with a small stream/river inside, but we went in wrong tine, it was almost noon. Morning or evening will be the best time to visit this park.
Nice park to stroll in and get away from the sun and into the shade a bit. A Lake in the middle and a café to by some drinks from.

The park is well-maintained and gives a sense of serenity amidst chaotic Colombo life style. Just wish  they had activities for adults as well .The kids play area could be  larger or diverified enough.
Good park to visit big and clean with a lake inside it good place to take a break from the sun in the middle of the day!

This park is the main and only central park in Colombo.   It is worth a visit.  The beautiful Buddha is exquisite.   The park is also a great place to see local families playing with their children - a bit of daily life.

This park is also known as Victoria Park and is a nice spot to get away from the hustle-bustle of the traffic.  There is a large playground area for children and plenty of paths to walk around the park.  You might see a number of tree squirrels too, which are super cute! At the north east end of the park you can see the relatively new Town Hall which looks like a smaller version of The White House! The park is also close to Paradise Road and there are other shops (ODEL) reasonably close by.  It is also not too far away from Gangaramaya Temple and the National Museum and Art Gallery are on the south side of the park. On Sundays the local artists display their work which is available for purchase.  They are there nearly all day (weather permitting). The park has been maintained well although it was a bit dry due to drought.  With rain, it would look lush and beautiful, but would recommend wearing mosquito repellant as there were some there even though it was very dry.
Viharamahadevi Park, known earlier as Victoria Park, is Colombo's only central park. It's been done-up for quite a while now and it looks great, especially in the evenings.

Many shaded places, sit and planned the next destination, But no restaurant inside the park. If you want some water or any other beverages please bring from road side (mobile shop). Also few beggars & young couple may disturb the tourist..
Went for a walk through the park in the middle of the day. Many park benches and young couples enjoying the evening.
the viharamahadevi park in colombo city is a good place to visit for nice HDR photo, best to visit in early morning to avoid the crowd
It is a lakeside park. There is a hanging bridge where you can click a few cool snaps. This park is common among the locals.

Truly an oasis in the middle of the busy city. At first glance . it's hard to fathom how big the place is. Its a lovely place to just walk around to escape the big city. There is a lovely little childrens park there with few events such as pony rides that goes on during the weekends. On one side of the park is a wonderful street of artworks by local artists for sale .
This is one of the best places in Colombo city limits to rest and enjoy the shelter of the tress. Plenty of spaces for children.

A decade ago this place was full of lovers but now under the wing of Gov/forces its well maintained and anyone could have a peaceful walk around and enjoy the greenery . Best time to visit is early in the morning as during evenings it get really crowded. surrounding has few cafes shopping malls and galleries that you could also visit. my favorite is the paintings by the road
A walk through this park just made me feel sad that so many young Colombians do not have access to personal/intimate space. Lots of lovely, old, gigantic, gnarly trees around.

Clean and Green - two words which doesn't go together when speaking about Colombo,SriLanka, but this place has been quite brilliant after the restoration. the food options are limited , the canteen type of place has nothing to eat nor any juices (really bad cz colombo heat) the place is kept really clean kudos to the municipal council for that
Very nice park in heart of Colombo. Beautiful trees all around. We hear of new cultural project Cirque Lanka which will run from december 2017 in nice open air theatre.

A lot of different trees and plans which is nice to see. I saw cinnamon tree first time in my life. But be ready there are bets on the tree which is not dangerous during the day and actually night too but just be careful :)
in the middle of Colombo city a huge garden open to public.good play area for children. food courts available and safe for the children

I walked to the park one evening because I and was told it was a good place to see the local fruit bats (flying foxes).  Whilst I did see them (and they are splendid) it's a lovely, spacious park, beautifully designed and a nice place to walk, picnic and relax.

i go there often,  mostly cutting across the park as a short-cut.  i go to sit under a shade and read.  i go there just to watch kids, adults, people of all ages rambling thru in sublime relaxation.  kids have their own amusement park, lovers their private seats or benches, and the families a nice clean patch of grass for their picnics.
This is a good place to lie down and relax during the evenings or go for a walk . There are many people around 6 after work who come here to jog and exercise
Compared to many other parks elsewhere in this region of the world this is a minimalist park .Small and nothing much to do or see. Locals use it for evening strolls and kids play games and that's it.

This is the main park in Colombo .located it heart of Colombo. A good place for a couple to go and stay for couple of hours in relax can have a good walk while having a good conversation. Also for groups it a good place to meetup and take pics. you can take food from outside and have it there.. also lots of small food stalls around it.
A well managed park. One of the attractions of Colombo. You must visit it If you are staying in Colombo.

It is a great place to escape from the Colombo heat and enjoy the stroll in the shade of giant trees. It is busy place but nobody paid any attention to us, and no 'gardener' was offering us his guided tour (mentio pned in some other reviews). While you are in the park do not miss open are art sale along the fence of the park.

I have been to Viharamahadevi Park on and off during the weekends while wait for something. This is a nice place with lush green and its a huge park and has a jogging track of 3km around the park. This is an ideal place for families to relax and kids to play at any time of the day as it has so much shades inside the park. During the weekends its get crowded near the kids activities area as lot of families opt to visit this place. There are plenty of garden seats kept inside the park and so many people opt to relax even during weekdays. This is an excellent place to visit. I pass this area everyday as my office is in the vicinity.
Fine to stroll through to museum. Might have more of a vibe on weekend or evening. Very hot during day with little respite.

Visited this place after about 16 years since my last visit and I was pleasantly surprised to see all the good changes. The park has become a lot cleaner and a family friendly place. Yes the place needs some improvements, for example raising the awareness of public about littering, but all in all it was a very nice experience. Don't forget to cross the road and visit the National Museum and Laksala/Museum Cafe

Good for small children as they can run around, sit in a paddle boat, sit on a horse or a horse carriage, eat ice cream and other snacks. There is no entry fee. It is a big park with multiple entry/exits.

An interesting place to stroll and relax/meditate early morning or late evening. There is a play area for kids which does tend to be overcrowded on weekends but it's quite entertaining. For visitors there are a few places of interest around the park including the town hall which looks a bit like a mini white house from the outside!!!

In Viharamahadevi Park, there are gigantic fruit-eating bats dwelling in the taller trees. If you ask a local, he or she can show you the cinnamon trees growing in the park. The large Buddha welcomes you with calm vibes at the entrance. Many couples go here for "privacy", but everyone can see them. If you're uncomfortable with seeing people smooch around you, then maybe this isn't the best choice for you.

Took two groups of children for a fun time. The park looked cared for and w]provided a great environment for children to run around and enjoy outdoor games. There were people patrolling the park and picking up litter which was much appreciated.

Nice stroll through the park. Many couples here and families. Go see the fruit bats, they are huge and like to argue with the crows :) Small restaurant in the middle of the park for drinks, snacks, ice cream etc. In the West end I even had a snake charmer approach me with a Cobra in a basket... I'm guessing the fangs were removed... horses also here and food drinks carts... nice walk.

Our tuk tuk driver brought us to the park and it seems that we were introduced to a 'head gardener' who interestingly knew the driver but oddily didn't wear the typical gardeners' attire, as others did. And so we were walked around and shown great species of trees and landscaping.  Don't miss the train tracks....it's discontinued now.....but hey, it gives you a glimpse of how it once was. There are no Tree Preservation Orders, given that fact some of the trees are hundreds of years old. You will see native trees, Mahogany, cloves.....it really is a great place for the locals to sit and relax in a very tranquil setting, which is effectively is in the heart of the city. It was the local childrens' last day at school and so it was just lovely to watch them playing the way we used to.....a trip down memory lane. Tour over and the 'head gardener' asked for a tip.  We gave him a tip so he could go on his way but then he demanded 5,000 Rupees......yes 5,000 Rupees.  He didn't ask once, nor twice but countless times to my husband, then me and then both of us.  In fact he got so close to me, I could smell alcohol.....My husband told him to leave us alone; that the tip was sufficient but 5,000 was a joke. Then coming out of the park, my husband met a guy with a bag slung over his shoulder - it was a cobra that he took out and said 'nice snake' until it bit at him and he put it away.  Great park but expect the unexpected!
Its nice family park to get relax. There is a small aquarium in there but it doesn't have much fish there. Sometimes its too crowded.

This is one of the places you should visit when your in Colombo.Located in the heart of Busy Colombo this park is good for a relaxing walk by the evening or jogging or workout.There is a Children play area in this part and this place is maintained well.
Enjoyed really a very peaceful environment also they have free WiFi spots so that makes it more amazing.

A huge huge park good for hanging out or just stopping by. Very crowded on holidays.. children have a separate area. The structures are very beautiful and overall the place would be biased towards to a park.
As I mentioned in the topic this is the Best place for get relax in Colombo without any fee. Just walk or sit on a chair.

The park is quite scenic and is the perfect place for a jog or to unwind with friends or loved ones, there is a separate place for children to play and the Amphitheatre is also located on the far end.

If you want to stroll / jog / cycle then this is an excellent place. The cycle track is approx. 2 Km per round. There is an inner walk way which can be 3 km per round if you do the 3 clover shape and an outer ring.

A good place to just chill out after a day under Colombo's heat, or after walking all around the city. It's just right across the Town Hall. Very low key, and refreshing to see lots of trees and plants around. You can just meander aimlessly along with any of the path walks scattered all over the park.

Well appointed in the city of Colombo next to the majestic Town Hall. the walkways and the park is very clean and well laid out . Activities for kids available . A healthy walk is facilitated for a few kilometers . Very popular place .
Good place to visit in Colombo. Highly recommended, but watch out for the scammers that pretend to be working as gardeners.
Its a nice place to visit and it has walking paths too.Its good to go with your children too Children has so many activities to attend.

This is the best and the biggest park.As a tour leader my advice is to start your visit from Town Hall entrance so that you cover many highlights.walking through the park from this end could be combined with the visit to Lotus pond.Colombo museum.Natural histry museum.Independence square.Archade shopping mall .Restaurants.If you are a person who likes soft walking in the cities you will like it on foot. Happy travelling !!! Sujan Weerakoon

is a public park located in Colombo, former name is Victoria park. It's maintain buy Colombo municipal council. The park was built on land donated to the Colombo city by Charles Henry de Soysa during the British rule of Sri Lanka, and used to be named "Victoria Park" after Queen Victoria. During World War II it was occupied by the British Army with Australian 17th Brigade based at Victoria Park. After the war the park was restored and open to the public in 1951.

I have used the walking paths of Viharamahadevi park and with the renovations it is truly relaxing place. I enjoyed the walk and in the mildest of very active area of Colombo this soothing environment is a real blessing. Hope the people will protect the renovations and keep the place clean.
Nicely maintained garden in Colombo. People come here with family. Good for jogging. However bit busy on holidays and weekends
The park is very well laid out with plenty of walking space. In the evening the lamp posts light up to make it very warm inviting place.

The surroundings and the park echoes the direction the country is heading towards beautification and it is commendable how the users of the park have embraced the need to keep it free of litter. The park is testimony that how difficult lessons could be taught by simple examples.

Colombo has not many public parks. Viharamahedevi or Victoria park is one in the middle of the City, just 1/2 Km away from most City attractions like museum, Fort Station, Fort Bus Station, Marine Drive, Main City Hotels etc. Can spend some good time amongst tropical trees, have a tea, talk to some locals and also a Kids play area. But dont expect so much..
A place for a family evening to relax,  enjoy the big trees and let the children play... be away from TV & phones.  Mingle with people, make new friends, smile with each other and be refreshed.

Nice place in Colombo center - for friends, families and kids. The best is that every Tuesday there is Rollerblading club sessions! From 5 to 7 pm! For kids and adults) so if you love sport - you are welcome to join :)
a place to take your kids and family for day outing with a kids play area to put the kids to place. clean place as the army maintains the cleaning part.

We visited on Eid. The entire park was in action with families having their pick-nicks, kids on horse back, others riding in a carriage pulled by horses, a long line of interesting food stalls. beautiful park with clean walk ways, pavilions, play ground and water.
Nothing much to do. A large golden Buddha statue in the centre of the park. Can view from the outside.

If you need to walk in the morning and wish to avoid the sun, then Viharamahadevi Park is an excellent choice. Nice landscaping, parking space, less crowd in the morning makes it more attractive. There are few options for food, but I haven't seen toilet facilities.

A city is generally not a place once associates with trees. However, this is a place that's got some lovely old trees and walking paths. Would be good after a long or hot day of site seeing. Its quite close to independence square, so might consider combining the 2. While you're at the park, you might also like to check out the art scene in Colombo where artists have their paintings etc on displace along the roadside. Ask where the art gallery is and you would find the artists on the road.
We just stopped to take a few pictures here since it was a hot and sultry day. This is opposite to White house building

The renovated park now offers relaxing environment in Colombo 7 area. This place is good for a walk or a jog since it has a track stretching around the park. Ample parking is available around the park.

Located in the heart of the city, its by far one of the most beautiful and well maintained parks i have ever seen. and esp in the tropical belt of the globe. Has well defined paths for walking and cycling. You can rent out cycles for cycling around the park on a track also. Landscapes and fauna is well maintained and managed. Must visit for peace, leisure and relaxing
Another very popular park within the Colombo city limits. This may be no as well-maintained as Independence Square, but definitely is a good place for children to play, relax, and for couples... :)

On the way in our city tour we visited this park. We did not have much time so we saw this park from outside only. It is a big park and I had some  extra time then could have gone inside the park. But i feel an outside view is good enough since we have seen much beautiful parks in kandy and Nuwara Eliya.

The temple was nice but the treAtment I got as a tourist was Dissappointing. A donation is compulsory and even the amount is stated. It does not tally with the concept of Buddhism. The head priest seems like a businessman . This temple creates a bad image to a Buddhist country. We should be able to freely walk in to a temple.

It was formerly known as Victoria Park named after Queen Victoria by the British. Today it is the Vihara Maha Devi Park, to honour the Queen mother of the Great Sri Lankan King from the South, Dutugemunu. This park is located in the cultural hub of Colombo adjoining the best residential suburb Colombo has Cinnamon Grand. The Art Gallery, national museum, Colombo Library. Professional organisations, and many other artistic and culturally significant facilities are situated in this location. This is a beautifully laid out garden with trees, shrubs and flowers as well as walking tracks, foot paths and open spaces. You have the shade frim the scorching sun, birds, street furniture and lights for the eveni t crowds.
Nice place to walk along the green grass. More suitable for couples. Play area is also situates here for children.

Great place to go for a stroll or picnic.  lots of little things for kids to enjoy. the only down side was the garbage whitle place was cleaned up the smell from the garbage disposal bins were quite bad from time to time

column7: Sri Jayewardanepura Kotte, null, Sri Lanka
column11: This one of the largest manmade relaxation places in Colombo with a modern walk way, children's park and ample space to enjoy the day alone or with your family to relax enjoy the greenery surrounded by concrete jungle.

It's a beautiful and natural environment. You can actually have good time apart from a lot of couples misbehaving in public so it's not really the perfect place for your little ones. If you're a couple visiting this place I don't think it's the perfect place for you either because there are guards spying on you since there are lots of other couples misbehaving there so they try their best to avoid it. It's not really a problem if you're visiting with friends. There's a beautiful lake,food stalls and you can lie down on the beautiful green grass to read a book,have lunch or have a conversation with your friends. Viharamahadevi Park is a winner.  It's large, cool and packed with locals on the weekends.  But there are still quiet corners to just sit & watch the world wander past. The locals love it, so there are pony rides, mechanical rides, snack stands, but also HUGE trees, a flying fox colony, plenty of cool, shady walks and even a quiet, charming, open air cafe. Viharamahadevi Park formerly known as Victoria park in the heart of Colombo is the most soothing green lung for all the city dwellers. This is just in front of the Town Hall, which (in addition to a statue of the Buddha) is excellent for tourists on the look out for landmarks to photograph. Also, very close by are the National Art Gallery, Colombo Museum and adjacent shop, Colombo Public Library, Nelum Pokuna Theatre, National Hospital and Girl Guides Headquarters. Plenty of shopping at various levels, ditto eating places. The park itself is a pleasure to walk around. Don't miss the hundreds of large fruit bats hanging from favoured trees. Also the herbarium and orchid house (rather neglected these days unfortunately). The small lake (large pond) has not only fish but also birds, such as kingfishers and herons. There is a 'Kiddies Section'. If you happen to visit at the time of a Perahera (religious procession in the evening) the elephants taking part in the procession are fed, watered and generally relax in the daytime in this park. Many of Colombo's residents come in the mornings or evenings for their daily walks. Paintings are on sale by artists in the open-air on one street (Ananda Cumarasamy Mawatha) bordering the park. Don't encourage touts, beggars etc who can be a nuisance and spoil your outing.

Paved pathways, well-maintained grass and big shady trees are what make this park a great place to hang out in downtown Colombo, and be sure to also check out the long rectangular-shaped "reflecting pool" on the northeast side of the park and the horse corral (not so sure those were ponies or just "younger" horses that I saw in there) on the southwest side of the park pretty much on the other end of the straight path from the reflecting pool. Personally though, this park is memorable not for the park itself but for this "Town Hall" building which looks "somewhat" like the White House in Washington (the alikeness applies to just the two "width sides" of the building though, so I wouldn't call it a replica of the White House, and also this building has a dome above unlike the White House) just across the road from the Park on the northeast side (where the reflecting pool is). Nearby, just about a 15-minute walk north from this park are Colombo's two famous temples, namely Seema Malaka on the green Beira Lake and Gangaramaya with its "unique & creative" display of rows of Buddhas (each one higher than the one in front like spectators' stands in a stadium); also about a 15-minute walk but to the west from the park is the Kollupitiya Junction roundabout on Galle Rd. running parallel (and very close) to the seaside with Galle Face Green (a "lively" seaside promenade with vendors selling food & drinks lined up along one side) another 10 to 15 minutes from the roundabout after a right turn onto Galle Rd.. Also, the National Museum is just like across the road from the south side of the Park although I didn't get to it myself.

White House is located at Wellawatta, Colombo. Just opposite is Vihara Mahadevi Park. The Viharamahadevi Park (formerly Victoria Park) is a public park located in Colombo, near the National Museum in SriLanka. It is the oldest and largest park in Colombo. Situated in front of the colonial-era Town Hall building, White House the park is named after Queen Viharamahadevi, the mother of King Dutugamunu. We went for a long walk. There are facilities for children to play and also boating facility in the park. The park covers a large area with well laid walk ways and shaded by trees. This is a nice place to visit with kids in the evening. The white house opposite to the park houses government offices and has a magnificent view.

Few years back Viharamahadevi Park is just another place situated in the middle of Colombo. But today it is a nicest place to hangout for a while in a busy day. You can come to Viharamahadevi Park by bus or by private vehicle. It is in Town Hall (The Colombo Municipal Council). Public bus routes No. 138, No. 120, No. 177, No. 170 and No. 190. It it in the centre of Colombo so just Rs. 200/= - 400/= will be the fare for private cab or for tuk tuk. After the renovation done by the Urban Development Council with the help of SL Army, the park is one of the best places to hang out for any time of the day. Earlier it was closed after 5p.m but now there are no fences or gates, so people can go in there and spend time at any time. Sri Lanka Police officers are doing patrols through the park, there for you can have no fear for any kind of threats. There are many activities that you can do in the Viharamahadevi park. If you have interest in doing exercise there are walking paths longer more then 2km, if you like to cycle around the park there are cycling paths and you can rent some bicycles, to sit and chat there are huge grassland and if you are a reader there are many benches for you to do your thing. In the evenings you can see a beautiful sunset too. There is a children's park for free of charge and children can do many activities in side that area. There are few public toilets and the condition of those are good. You can find many food stalls around the park and few are situated in side the park too. Food cost is not too high. If you are in Colombo, you should visit this place and feel the freedom which your mind can get. Trust me, you'd be amazed.

A nice place to stroll around and obtain relative relative peace away from pestering locals (unusual in Sri Lanka).  Well maintained with a picturesque lake. Not that big but worth a visit. Get a tuk tuk to White House and enter there.

i live a stone's throw from this park which is bang in the heart of Colombo and adjoining the Town Hall. Not many years ago, it was a breeding ground for small drug peddlers and prostitutes in the evenings and unless one really wanted to take a short cut to the other side, it was not a journey a person would like to take, especially after dark. However, it has been transformed to its old glory and better, I think, because there are dedicated areas for activity, a children's play area with water spouts and exercise points and beautifully paved walkways and a jogging and cycling track.  The brainchild of this transformation was Mr. Gotabhaya Rajapakse,  former Sec. of Defence, who, under the auspices of the Urban Development Authority, commenced a 'Make Colombo clean and beautiful' campaign, a reality.  It is patrolled by police and so well lit and used by hundreds, that safety is not an issue any more. In fact, it is a public space worthy of commendation, in a busy city where one can go to for peace and quiet or exercise or just to hang out with friends.

This is the biggest park in Colombo. Placed in the heart of Colombo, its history dates back to 19th century. The park is just opposite the town hall (Colombo Municipal Council) building which itself is a beautiful colonial structure. On the other side of the park is the National Museum Compound. The national Museum Compound is home to one of the very few monuments of Queen Victoria. Next to the park is the public library which in itself is an attraction for any one wanting to know more. The library compound is home to the war memorial in Colombo. The park is full of beautiful trees and plenty of places to relax after a busy day in colombo. There are plenty of walkways if one hopes to exercise.
